text:
Hey everyone,
when it comes to your team members' goals and responsibilities, would you say the same person (eg: content specialist or content editor) is responsible for guaranteeing content quality & ranking #1 for a given keyword? I mean, knowing that ranking #1 is a multi-skilled effort (that included not only the relevance of the content, but also page rank, backlinks, ux, etc), does it make sense do hold someone accountable for ranking #1 for that keyword?

I'm asking that because I'm not quite sure if the same person who edits our content should also be responsible for going after backlinks, cross promotion, for example.

I see it as a challenge of scale more than an issue of right or wrong team structure. I am, effectively, our in-house SEO and content person (and am accountable for non-paid user growth).

Would it be nice to have someone else take some tasks off my plate? Sure. Would it help us scale things (like post updates) more quickly? Yes.

But is it also beneficial for me (as a writer) to be in the weeds of keyword research, rankings, social sharing, etc., as an analyst? Definitely.
